snippet: Several officials, including a top aide to Prime Minister Petr Necas, are reported to have been detained. The coalition government has been rocked by a series of corruption scandals.
abstract: Czech Prime Min Petr Necas says he has no intention of resigning despite raid by  organized crime unit on government offices in Prague and arrest of several officials; motives for arrests remain unclear, but raid threatens to bring down center-right coalition government already weakened by series of corruption scandals.

byline.contributor: Hana de Goeij contributed reporting from Prague.

lead_paragraph: Several officials, including a top aide to Prime Minister Petr Necas, are reported to have been detained. The coalition government has been rocked by a series of corruption scandals.

headline.main: Czech Premier Says He Won’t Resign, Despite Raid and Arrests of Officials
headline.print_headline: Czech Premier Says He Won’t Resign, Despite Raid and Arrests of Officials
